UranusLost: ^Uranus doesn't seem interested in talking to you.
UranusFirst: ^Why hello there! Might you be here to visit Uranus?
^You are in luck, because your search ends here. You are speaking to the one and only.

c-0: ^ Wait, Uranus? Like, uh... hehe, like...
c-1: ^Of course you do! I am the pioneer of the tilted look. I am the glimpse of the blue sky that stands out confidently against the dark void of vacuum.

dontsayit: ^DON'T! YOU! SAY IT! Imbecile, I'll have you know I carry the namesake of a deity of the great skies! If you would make it your laughing stock then you may see yourself out!

c-0: ^ I'm sorry. I am so sorry.
^Thank you. That farce is a low-hanging fruit, and a rotten one at that. Many folks innocently pick at it, unknowing of the irritation it causes me.
^Furthermore, I must apologize for the immediate outburst. Might we restart on the right foot?
^Wonderful. Then I am Uranus, the glimpse of the blue sky that stands out against the void of dark space, and the pioneer of the axial tilt.

knowyou: ^I'm not like the other planets, not even the other ice giants-- folks would trek for countless astronomical units just to meet me! That is the reason you have come here, is it not?
^Yeah, I wanted to get to know you better.

c-0: ^ Um... yeah, I wanted to... chat with you.
c-1: ^ Um... yeah, I wanted to... chat with you.
c-2: ^ You, uh... so you've got a lot of good stuff going on, huh.
^Indeed. I strive to be the best planet that I can become. Thus, I must take inventory of my strengths so that I may nurture them.
^However, I would scorn to allow vanity to befall me. It is a deadly sin that plagues even the most unsuspecting.
^Therefore, I must not risk even to humor it.
^So enough about me! What might you be interested in conversing about, hmm? Tell me about yourself!

chat: ^Oh, splendid! Conversing with others does bring me such joy.
^Might you be interested in the fluid dynamics of methane and hydrogen under pressure? Or, if that is a bit much, have you any interest in theistic philosophy?

c-2: ^My apologies. Just some impassioned interests escaping.
^So, what shall we discuss, other than advanced subjects? Would you perhaps like to tell me about yourself?

yapping: ^Of course! Now with the simple foundations...
^Uranus blathers on about some incomprehensible topical jarson.
^But, one must never neglect the edge case, despite its perceived insignificance...
^It seems a bit as though they are just trying to sound "intellectual."
^... but like I demonstrated, it is a simple yes or no question, when you get down to it.

g-0: ^Erm, actually, that is not correct. Technically, it is the state of...
^Uranus explains why you are wrong in equally as confusing and extraneous detail.
^But with that out of the way, my intuition admonishes me that this may have been a bit much to start with.
^I thank you for your interest, however.
^So, what shall we discuss, other than advanced subjects? Would you perhaps like to tell me about yourself?

c-1: ^ I'm, er, I was... you'd know me as Earth's moon...
c-2: ^ I'm, er, I was... you'd know me as Earth's moon...
g-0: ^A pleasure to make your acquaintance, Earth's moon. What else brings you to the outskirts of our lovely system-- other than a visit?

c-3: ^ Uh, like you said... to meet you...
^Oh, how charming! Well, meet me you have. Thus, your quest is surely complete.

looking: ^A worthy endeavor! Despite the relative lack of light, there is much to see in our part of the system!
^You could meet Neptune and Pluto. The pair of them are not terribly accustomed to guests, but they are good folks, deep down.
^You could also visit the Kuiper belt. Sadly, Eris is not around as of late, however I do hear that there are some lovely comets about instead!
main2: ^Ariel, hello! Would you like to meet our visitor?
^Actually, I came to say, is there something you may be forgetting about?
^My word, you are correct! Please let the other moons know I will arrive shortly.
^Apologies, Earth's moon, I must leave. I am late for group trivia night! Thanks for the chat, kind stranger! Ciao!
^Uranus departs to be with their moons.

UranusSecond: ^Oh, hello, Earth's moon! It is a pleasure to see you again.
^Rarely do I receive the opportunity to converse with others, and even less often the same folks twice! I do have a habit of running my mouth faster than their attention spans.
^Are you sure it's not because ur anus
^Hold up, you don't even talk to your own moons?

c-0: ^ Are you sure it's not because of...
c-1: ^ Yeah, nice to talk with you again.
c-2: ^ Wait, you mean you... don't talk to your moons?

anus: ^Really, Earth's moon, I trusted you were better than this.

b: ^It is no funnier the second time, I assure you.
^I would ask you hold an ounce of regard for my own state of mind, but it seems you did not understand the request initially.
^Thus I now instead ask for you to increase the physical space between us by a significant amount.
^Allow me to translate: please leave me alone.
^I would ask you to hold an ounce of regard for my own state of mind.

trivia: ^It was delightful! Miranda bested us all, as usual. On some themed rounds the rest of us may prevail, but they are the true master.
^Ariel also startled us all briefly with their concerningly specific insight into other moons' habits, but refused to elaborate.
^Such behavior is not terribly out of line for them. Ever the mysterious one.
^Although I wager that you would understand their likenesses by experiencing them for yourself, rather than simply having me declare them to you.
^Thus, might you be interested in meeting some of my moons?
^I told them all about our lovely conversation from earlier. They seem to esteem you.
moons: ^Of course I do! I care for each one dearly.

c-0: ^... what?! My moons mean everything to me. I... I could not fathom a different reality!
^It's just hard to imagine when, you know...
^I've... lived in that other reality... for as long as I know.

g-0: ^I suppose I should clarify my earlier confusing words. I meant that I do not typically converse with others outside my immediate vicinity. Indeed, I keep company with my dear orbiters all the time.
^Must feel nice to be in their place.

c-3: ^Thank you! We all do our best to care for each other. I may indulge in some rambling and passion for other subjects from time to time, but they are truly the most important to me.
^I would be confident to assert that the same applies of me to them. Truly, they are all so wonderful...
^Oh, but allow me to share this insight-- you would surely observe it objectively for yourself, rather than by me simply declaring it to you!
^Thus, might you be inclined to meet my moons?

troubles: ^Am I hearing you correctly, Earth's moon? Oh dear, are you having troubles with your planet?

c-0: ^Might I offer you advice? The key to a successful relationship is respectful and open communication.
^It may be difficult to initiate and carry such a conversation. However, it will be worth far more to have discussed your worries openly!
^Earth and I aren't going to be discussing anything anymore.
^Would you like to talk about it?
^I understand. Know that I am willing to assist you to the best of my ability. If you would wish it.

c-1: ^I understand. Know that I am willing to assist you to the best of my ability. If you would wish it.
g-0: ^Of course. Now, what may get us out of this rut? Ah, I know just the thing! Say, I was hoping to introduce my moons to you, now that we all have a morsel of time to spare. They are all so delightful. Would you be interested?

main: ^Would I get to play trivia night?
^No way, I'm supposed to be your moon.

c-0: ^ Would I get to play trivia night? :)
^Aha! I would be delighted to include you in our recreation!
^I have no doubt the others would agree. But why not hear it from themselves? Allow me a moment...
c-1: ^Here, just a moment, I shall summon them.
c-2: ^Splendid! Allow me but a moment; I shall summon them.
g-0: ^Uranus takes a moment to call over all of their moons. There are more than you initially guessed.

b: ^Earth's moon, eh? I'm Oberon. Heard you're a bit of a jokester.
^Don't sweat it. When Uranus and I first met? Did the exact same thing.
^Yup. Don't tell anyone, but they do find it a little funny, coming from the right somebody.

g-0: ^Pleased to meet you. You can call me Umbriel.
^... and that was a plot to get the spacey one to talk. Ariel, at your service.
^Greetings. To learn my name, you must prove your worth.
^Come now, that's a bit idiosyncratic, Mir-
^Perfect. Now, a question, straight from the great mental libraries of Venus:

^Earth is awfully of their latest pet project, the "humans." Apparently, these tiny, squishy blobs can alter their landscape over time. What is most astounding is that they never live long enough to see the result.
^Now, how long does one of these humans last, on average... in Earth days?

c-5: ^A valid sentiment. However, an incorrect answer.

g-1: ^Call me Miranda. I agree-- even with the home advantage, that was a tough one.
^But I do fear we may be hoarding your time already. Swear you will join us again for trivia night?
^Splendid! I will be anticipating your next visit.

b: ^And, Earth's moon? Do remember to reserve a moment to yourself to rest and reflect.
^And, Earth's moon? Do keep my advice in mind. I have utmost faith in you!

UranusThird: ^Earth's moon, welcome back! I was greatly anticipating our next encounter. In fact, we all were.
^Really? Thanks. I was looking forward to it, too.
^Of course! Your company is a great pleasure.
^Now, have we any ideas for today's chatter...
^I was thinking, you're honestly really kind.
^Can I talk to you about my previous relationship?

c-0: ^ I dunno. You wanna try and teach me about methane again?
c-1: ^ I was thinking, you are honestly just... so kind.
^To me... to your moons... to everyone.
^You believe in everyone. You are caring to everyone.
^By the stars, Earth's moon, that has just... touched me at the core. Thank you, truly.
^It is my belief that one shows their greatest respect when they genuinely care.
^And, I really do not mean to pry, nor offend, but...
^By your conduct... Earth's moon, is that sign of respect something you have been lacking?
c-2: ^Could I... talk about my experience with Earth?

b: ^I wasn't really ready last time, but...

c-2: ^I think I'm a bit more comfortable opening up now.
^Please do. I will hear you out through your finale.

methane: ^Bah! You jest! It is an inviting suggestion, but I would keep you here until next year, truly.
^Just ask any of my moons about it. I tend to talk their metaphorical ears off.
^Well, maybe I wanna stay with you longer than that.

c-0: ^ Well, maybe I'm alright with staying here for that long...
c-1: ^ Heh, I'm sure they don't mind!
^Well, thank you. This is a good thing, because I enjoy chatting to an extensive degree.
^I've enjoyed our chats too. You may have come off a bit... eccentric at first, but... we all are, in our own way.
^And you've been so kind. To me... and your moons, too.
^I can tell you really care about them.
^One shows their greatest respect when they genuinely care.
^Is that sight something you have been lacking?

staylonger: ^Was that some sort of suggestion, Earth's moon?!

b: ^Heh... maybe. Or just wistful thinking. You tell me.
^Ever since we split... I don't know if I'll ever find my place again.
^... my friend, do you perhaps wish to talk through your experience?
^But hold, what might Earth think of this conduct?

c-0: ^ We... split up a while ago.
^Oh dear. Would you like to talk about it?
c-1: ^ We... split up a while ago.
^Oh dear. Would you like to talk about it?

main: ^Earth and I really weren't in a great place.
^Sure, they were agreeable at first. Like, who would orbit an obvious prick?
^But after a while, they just completely ignored me. They only cared about their little surface projects.
^Their Cambrian oceans... those dinosaurs... now humans. There's always something more important going on.
^And to be honest, any further interaction was more like a performance review.
^"Keep those tides going! Hey, could you shed some light on my dark side?"
^"What do you mean, you missed the meteorite?! Those were my favorite reptiles!"
^I was a tool with no say, really. And I got fed up after a while.
^My word. I... had no idea the extent to which your sitaution caused you to suffer. I am glad you feel comfortable enough to confide in me.
^Yeah, and not to mention those humans.

c-1: ^ Yeah. And after those humans just up and landed on me? That was enough.
c-2: ^ Yeah. I know that was a lot, but... thank you for hearing me out.

humans: ^NO WAY! They just... let them land on your surface without permission like that?!
^Oh, uh, sorry for interrupting. Just couldn't let that slide.
^And we wonder why they know our daily routines to the letter...
^Nevertheless, I agree. I can only imagine how violating that must feel.
^And on top of all the other transgressions...
hearing: ^It's nice to get to tell someone.
^Even nicer that you just... kind of always know what to say. To help me feel a little better.
^Thank you. I may never know what an individual is feeling at all times. Thus I believe it right to treat all others with compassion.
^If I speak too quickly or erroneously make an assumption, that is okay. That is what a sincere apology and accountability is for.
^I am pleased to hear that my policy affirms itself with you. And it is my sincere hope that your state improves after all you have been through.
main2: ^I'm glad I got out, but... I don't really know what to do now.
^Despite the uncertainty it may be causing you, it was the correct choice. And in times of uncertainty, it is imperative to think things over carefully.
^Consider your most eminent values. Turn to the counsel of individuals you trust for guidance.
^And, you are already progressing in one of those steps. Bravo! Although, given my speech patterns, there may not be much value to my counsel.
^Don't sell yourself short. You have been a huge help through all of this.
^I am so glad I can accomplish that for you, Moon. So very glad.
^Me too. Thank you so much. Not just for listening. For all your help. For everyone you've done for me.
^When you depart, I request that you take that aforementioned reflection time.
^Allow yourself to exist in the uncertainty for a while. Let yourself flow past it with tranquility.
^I think I will. Thank you, Uranus.
^And thank you, Moon. For looking past my quirks. For knowing me for real.
^One more time, then... ciao for now!

UranusFourth: ^Oh, Moon! I am just related at your arrival! Come, tell me how you fare and what is on your mind.
^Well... I've been going around, thinking of some... final goodbyes.
^My lone orbit is getting unstable, so my time for loitering around here is running out.
^... I see. This... brings me sorrow. Will you ever return?
^Well, about that. You know... despite that looming anxiety, I've been trying to think things over. Like you said.
^Would you allow me to orbit you?
^OOO! I can vouch! A sweetheart and a total hoot, what's not to love?
^Ariel seems to have shown up out of nowhere.
^As can I. Moon is both considerate, and a worthy opponent.
^Absolutely, I think they'll be right at home here.
^The rest of the moons seem to have followed suit.
^Oh, Moon, I thought you'd never ask!!! Yes, of course you may! Uncountably infinite times, yes!
^The moons crowd around like some sort of hydrostatically equilibrated group hug.
^There is one loose end... it would be just silly to continue referring to you simply as Moon. Might there be a name you may have in mind?
^I can assist with ideas if you'd like, but be warned-- most of them originate from my favorite fables.
^by my core, by my atmosphere, by everything in between,
^I will treat you with the respect and care you deserve as an individual.
^I will treat you better than the scoundrel Earth who cast you away.
^And you will have a place here, for as long as the great universe expands.
